means: （使）人口减少( depopulate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Whole stretches of land were laid waste and depopulated.
sentence.Network_cn: 一片片土地荒芜，人口减少。

sentence.Network_en: Ever higher dues ruined trade and depopulated towns.
sentence.Network_cn: 越来越高的苛捐杂税使商业凋敝,城镇人口减少.

sentence.Network_en: The rotational levels of the ground vibrational level may be depopulated by radiation.
sentence.Network_cn: 基态振动能级的各转动能级的粒子数可能因幅射而减少.

entry.def: To depopulate an area means to greatly reduce the number of people living there.

example.ex: The famine threatened to depopulate the continent.
example.tran: 饥荒可能会导致该大洲人口剧减。

means.word_mean: 1. having lost inhabitants as by war or disease;

sentences.sentence: "the 15th century plagues left vast areas of Europe depopulated"
